title: update to RSA 0.7.0 interfaces
body:
This depends on https://github.com/RustCrypto/RSA/pull/195 and needs updated md5 and ripemd crates to provide OIDs

Note: it might be simpler to just restore the rsa::Hash struct in the RSA crate.

title: feat: allow subkeys to be created with the authentication flag enabled
body: The method `can_authenticate(bool)` was missing from the `SubkeyParams` builder but was supported by everything further down.  I have tested this by generating a key that has an authenticate subkey and using this to successfully log into a Linux server using SSH.

title: Remove unused circular dependency and also rewrite IV handling to not require lazy_static
body: The old code was taking a copy of IV. Instead, we can just use `GenericArray::from` to convert the `u8` array into a `GenericArray`. This approach has the same cost (for the copy) without the need for `lazy_static`.

title: Replace find_map with a find
body:
The argument is not transformed, so find is sufficient.

This change fixes a clippy error causing the CI to fail.

title: Upgrade pretty_assertions to 1
body: The crate was stabilized.

title: Remove unused clear_on_drop dependency
body: `clear_on_drop` seems to be completely replaced by `#[zeroize(drop)]`.

title: Add comma in `README` for clearer message
body: I think it makes it less ambiguous

title: feat: apply clippy and update some deps
Fix zeroize version
body:
Fixes #179 

This removes the non-standard requirement on zeroize, fixing ecosystem incompatibilities with rpgp.

title: Disable `oldtime` feature of `chrono`
body: It removes dependency on `time` crate.

title: Avoid some allocations via to_string
body:
&String can be compared with &str and &str satisfies the trait bounds
for std::fmt::builders::DebugStruct::field.

title: feat: edition 2021 and update crypto deps
body: bumps msrv to 1.57

title: Derive Clone on hasher types
body:
I'm implementing cleartext signature verification using this crate
(I may contribute the code upstream once I have it working). A
problem I ran into is that as part of signature verification you
need to feed signature state into the hasher (which was already fed
the cleartext being verified). This means that you either need to
rehash the cleartext for each signature or maintain a per-signature
hasher. Both of these solutions are inefficient.

The hasher types used by this crate implement Clone. This means you
can have a single per-algorithm hasher then clone it before feeding
in signature state so you don't taint the hasher and can reuse it
for other signatures. However, because this crate's wrapper types
don't implement Clone, this optimization isn't available.

This commit implements Clone on this crate's hasher wrappers to
enable this optimization.

We may need to extend the Hasher trait with a clone-like function
to make this fully work. But I figured I'd test the waters by doing
making a hopefully non-controversial change first!

title: Replace try_from dependency with std::convert::Try{From,Into}
body:
std::convert::TryFrom is already used in src/line_reader.rs and has
been available since Rust 1.34:
https://blog.rust-lang.org/2019/04/11/Rust-1.34.0.html#tryfrom-and-tryinto

title: Add a method to construct a PublicKey from parameters.
body: Currently the only way to create a PublicKey is to have a pre-existing packet or to generate a new SecretKey and get it from there. This change adds a method that allows PublicKey objects to be synthesised from data from other sources, for example external key material.

body: Closes #137,#22

body:
- [x] fix changed interfaces
- [x] happy CI

title: fix: update & freeze deps to ensure build
body: Closes #134

title: chore: update dependencies
body: stream-cipher and block-cipher were moved into the cipher crate, so all depending crates had to be updated.

title: Simplify code by making Hasher implement std::io::Write
body:
This makes it possible to skip intermediate buffers and simplifies the code.

The upstream `Digest` in rustcrypto also supports this, so there is precedent for doing it this way.

No functional change.

title: Fix corruption of non-ascii characters in text literals
body:
First commit adds a test revealing the bug.

Second commit fixes the problem by making `normalize_lines..rs` work on bytes instead of chars.

This simplifies the code and it should be faster as well.

title: Make signature field of StandaloneSignature public
body:
This is consistent with many other structs defined in rpgp, and it's
hard to do basic things such inspecting details of the signature
otherwise.

title: document key differences between rPGP and Sequoia
body:
questions like that pop up here and there, most recently in #114

closes #114

nb: another difference: rpgp is easier to type than sequoia :D

title: Do not panic on IDEA cipher
update crypto deps
body: Blocked on https://github.com/RustCrypto/stream-ciphers/issues/163

title: feat: make sign/verify utilize trait std::io::Read
body: Closes #99

title: Fix ISA build versions specified
body: Android and Windows are the only platforms with 32 bits support for ARM and x86 being Windows fully 32 bits (x86_32) and in Android depending on the ISA. This is because of client framework limitations (Electron for desktop) and the state of some OS (iOS, Android, etc in their native platforms) but not the core itself.

title: Required updates due to ed25519-dalek moving to v1.0.0-pre.4
body:
Fixes #103.

Since `ed25519-dalek` moved to `v1.0.0-pre.4` (from `v1.0.0-pre.3`) approximately 15 hours ago, pgp no longer builds due to a change in the `ed25519-dalek` API.

The fix involves:

* Using the following now required traits in `src/crypto/eddsa.rs`: `signature::{Signature, Signer, Verifier}`
* Bringing in the signature crate as an explicit dependency (as this is where the above traits are exported)

title: Forbid unsafe code
body: This makes `cargo geiger` happy

title: Cleanup
feat: update dependencies
feat(key): add Signed(Public|Secret)Key::expires_at() method
body:
I'm missing a "simple" API to get the expiration date of a key, much like the `expires` or `expired` output of gpg:

```
pub   rsa4096 2014-10-14 [SCEA] [expired: 2018-09-15]
      XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
uid           [ expired] Test User <test@example.com>
```

title: Remove enum_primitive dependency
body: It is not used anywhere in rPGP code.

title: Turn info!() that are used for debugging/tracing into debug!()
body:
This would greatly improve the logging in applications that are using rpgp.
Note that some of those message could even become trace!().

See issue #75.

body: It is not complete and is not used in Delta Chat

title: Improve documentation and comments
Implement is_encryption_key for KeyTrait
Return true from is_signing_key for ECDSA keys
Clarify error message for EdDSA encryption
body:
"EdDSA encryption" is not going to be implemented. ECDH case is already implemented.

Closes issue #66

title: fix: do not log sensitive information
body:
Logs may be leaked accidentally and additional processing increases the
chance that this information will remain in memory.

Logging can be added as needed if required for debugging.

Related to #43

title: CI: Add cargo audit job
feat: return the same error from decrypt_protected on invalid MDC
body:
Previously `checksum::sha1()` called `ensure_eq!` and the resulting error
propagated upwards.  As it can end up in the logs or UI, it is better
to make it more generic to avoid accidental information leaks.

Additionally, compute SHA1 in advance, before performing the checks.
In the future, these checks can be made constant time, even though it
is out of scope of rPGP threat model for now.

title: fix(line-reader): improve correctness of LineReader::seek
body:
Currently `LineBreak::seek` processes only `io::SeekFrom::Current(n)` and immediately converts `n` to its absolute value.

I test that forward and backward seek works as expected (currently it doesn't, hence draft PR).
